public class SqliteSession
extends java.lang.Object
implements Session

setCacheSize

public Session setCacheSize(int cacheSize)
Description copied from interface: Session
Sets the Session cache capacity in terms of how many Objects it can store. The cache size dictates when the cache is recycled if it is configured to do so automatically. Once the cache reaches this capacity, it will be recycled. The cache can also be recycled manually by calling recycleCache(), which will reclaim it regardless of how Infinitum is configured.

Specified by:
setCacheSize in interface Session
Parameters:
cacheSize - the maximum number of Objects the cache can store
Returns:
Session to allow chaining

Description copied from interface: Session
Returns the maximum capacity of the Session cache in terms of how many Objects it can store.

Specified by:
getCacheSize in interface Session
Returns:
the maximum number of Objects the cache can store

save

public long save(java.lang.Object model)
          throws InfinitumRuntimeException
Description copied from interface: Session
Persists the given Object to the database. This method is not idempotent, meaning if the record already exists, a new one will attempt to persist.

Specified by:

Returns:
the row ID of the newly inserted record, or -1 if the insert failed

registerTypeAdapter

public <T> Session registerTypeAdapter(java.lang.Class<T> type,
                                       TypeAdapter<T> adapter)
Description copied from interface: Session
Registers the given TypeAdapter for the specified Class with this Session instance. The TypeAdapter allows a Field of this type to be mapped to a database column. Registering a TypeAdapter for a Class which already has a TypeAdapter registered for it will result in the previous TypeAdapter being overridden.

Specified by:
registerTypeAdapter in interface Session
Parameters:
type - the Class this TypeAdapter is for
adapter - the TypeAdapter to register
Returns:
Session to allow chaining

Returns:
{@code Map, ? extends TypeAdapter>

beginTransaction

public Session beginTransaction()
Description copied from interface: Session
Starts a new database transaction. If autocommit is enabled, invoking this method will have no effect. A transaction must be committed or rolled back by calling Session.commit() or Session.rollback(), respectively.

Specified by:
beginTransaction in interface Session
Returns:
Session to allow chaining

commit

public Session commit()
Description copied from interface: Session
Commits the current transaction. This method is idempotent. If no transaction is open or autocommit is enabled, this will have no effect.

Specified by:
commit in interface Session
Returns:
Session to allow chaining

rollback

public Session rollback()
Description copied from interface: Session
Rolls back the current transaction. This method is idempotent. If no transaction is open or autocommit is enabled, this will have no effect.

Specified by:
rollback in interface Session
Returns:
Session to allow chaining

isTransactionOpen

public boolean isTransactionOpen()
Description copied from interface: Session
Indicates if a transaction is currently open.

Specified by:
isTransactionOpen in interface Session
Returns:
true if a transaction is open, false if not

setAutocommit

public Session setAutocommit(boolean autocommit)
Description copied from interface: Session
Sets the autocommit value for this Session. If autocommit is enabled, a Session transaction must be initiated by invoking Session.beginTransaction(). A transaction must then be committed or rolled back by calling Session.commit() or Session.rollback(), respectively. If autocommit is disabled, database operations will be committed when they are executed.

Specified by:
setAutocommit in interface Session
Parameters:
autocommit - true to enable autocommit, false to disable it
Returns:
Session to allow chaining

isAutocommit

public boolean isAutocommit()
Description copied from interface: Session
Indicates if autocommit is enabled or disabled.

Specified by:
isAutocommit in interface Session
Returns:
true if autocommit is enabled, false if not
